Seminar on open source GIS with R and Quantum Gis

Friday June 14 2013, 9:00-12:00

Introduction to Quantum Gis

Dr Stefano Casalegno
9:00 - 10:00

  1. Quick start guide of QGIS
  2. Hands-on : importing rasters and vector files
  3. Hands-on : import, reproject, clipp and exporting a file
  4. Accessing GRASS and GDAL/OGR plugins
  5. Questions and answers


coffee break

Introduction to spatial data processing in R

Dr Jonathan Bennie
10:00 - 11:00

  1. Quick intro to spatial data processing in R
  2. raster and rgdal libraries
  3. Hands-on : importing rasters and vector files
  4. Hands-on : example of model/ data processing
  5. Questions and answers


Questions and answers

11:00 - 12:00
Bring your data we can discuss how to process them.

This is a practical training. To get prepared please please install Qgis and R in your portable computer.
  • install Qgis
  • install R
